listitem.para: Mocking is, at its essence, the generation of code for functions, with which we write tests.
For example, f may be a function which closes over a state variable, incrementing each time it is called. Then we may assert something about the resulting counter (e.g. f.count == 1).

sect2.title: Quantify on functions
sect2.para:
With automated testing, we may write properties that universally quantify on functions.
scala> forAll(( | f: String => Int, | g: List[Char] => String, | x: List[List[Char]]) => | x.map(f compose g) == | (x.map(g)).map(f) | ).check + OK, passed 100 tests.
